title: Thunderbird profile restore attempt--how can I get my data to be seen/into a readable format?
content:
was Windows 10 Pro, now Windows 11 Pro on replacement laptop (old one is not operational). I can't get my profile into Thunderbird because (presumably) I'd backed it up using my cloud backup service (and forgot that most of the time it's incremental), with the possibility of a straight copy from the old SSD if it's not fried.

How can I at least retrieve the data in there, (and/or convert it to a readable format) i.e. emails, that are in the Mail folder, including Local Folders? Some of that goes back to early 2000's, and some accounts that I no longer have. It's probably better to have most of that out of Thunderbird anyway, since my profile is ~99GB on disk.

Currently I have at least 7 active email accounts, and that fluctuates with .edu addresses. In the profile IMAP Mail folder, there are 20 .com account folders, a few of which are inactive or from changes, and a couple from setting up my main account just to see if that would link up with the associated files in the old profile (not). I can't tell what they all are except for those for which I'd made subfolders under the IMAP Inbox.

So since I don't only have 1-2 accounts, this is a big deal, and having to keep multiple browsers/private tabs open is not easy to work with. I'd even tried the Firefox Containers as a temporary work-around, but I'm having troubles with that.

Any help is appreciated! I can't get anything done, and the new laptop doesn't even have all that I need set up yet.
creator: radarrab

title: is anyone else experiencing a bug where after a while of using firefox you cannot left click links or type?
content:
a few months ago, i built a new computer and upgraded to windows 11. but i have been having a bug where after resuming use of a firefox window, i will at some point lose the ability to left clicks links or to type in any fields on the page. for my mouse, i can still properly left click web buttons, like the youtube players, and i can left click tabs to switch between them. right and middle click still work correctly as well. for the keyboard, i can use keybinds on my keyboard (ctrl-tab/ctrl-shift-tab/ctrl-a) or hit space bar/page up/page down to navigate, but typing in fields just doesnt work. this bug happens after some random point of using the program, so it could happen after 10 seconds or 10 minutes.

the only way to fix it is to switch to a different program momentarily, whether that be alt tabbing to a non firefox window or clicking the desktop. ive just tried switching all my extensions and everything off with troubleshoot mode, but still experienced the bug. ive also tried different keyboards and mice in different ports and had the same issue persist, so i dont think its my peripheral software since i used generic keyboards too.

does anyone have any suggestions on what could be happening here and if anyone is experiencing the same issue? its very frustrating

title: Firefox makes me sign in daily, instead of monthly like I do in Chrome
content:
This drives me absolutely crazy as I tried to narrow it down for days now. The Amazon Seller website makes me login daily, which is not a problem on Chrome. If I export the cookies from Chrome into Firefox it works, but also forgets it after about day. I can confirm:

- cookies are not the problem and don't expire, as they keep working in Chrome on the same machine and network and if I export them again from Chrome and import to Firefox even daily, it still works, so the cookies are fine - It's also not amazon's fault, let's say a stricter protection agains Firefox for example, for the same reason as above, they don't block the cookie - I turned off every protection, made sure cookies are persistent and I gave every exception to amazon's website but didn't help - it happens even if I don't close the browser, so it's not a problem with cookie deletion - I tried it in a completely clean new firefox profile, same problem

I'm losing my mind because of this..

title: Restore session
content: Before I get to the heart of the matter I need to clarify something. My browser have updated to the new version two days ago. When I open it yesterday it did not restore my session, I checked resently closed windows but it was clean. I looked on the forums and found out that I can use old copies of the session to restore it, unfortunately the "previous.jsonlz4" had already been overwritten, but I found three upgrade.jsonlz4 which may be suitable for restoration, I saved it and others files in another folder. It is a list of files that I have saved: 1.previous.jsonlz4 2.recovery.baklz4 3.recovery.jsonlz4 4. upgrade.jsonlz4-2025.... 5. upgrade.jsonlz4-2025.... 6. upgrade.jsonlz4-2025.... Then the forum said that I need to select one of the appropriate files, rename it to sessionstore.jsonlz4 and replace the old one. The problem is that I can't find sessionstore.jsonlz4. It was said that it appears after closing the browser, but I couldn't find it. Now after this introduction I can move on to my questions. Is it possible that this file is now called differently and this method of recovery can still be implemented? And are there other ways to restore the session? I would be very grateful for help.

title: Firefox Profile - Immer wieder ein neues Profil beim Start vom Firefox erforderlich
content:
Hallo zusammen, ich benötige dringend Unterstützung bezüglich des Standardprofils in Firefox. Bei einigen Mitarbeitern wird jeden Tag nach dem Neustart das Neuanlegen des Profils verlangt. Ich habe die alten Profile über about:profiles gelöscht und neue angelegt. Firefox habe ich auch deinstalliert und neu installiert, aber das brachte keine Lösung. Am nächsten Tag ist das Profil wieder defekt und es erscheint folgende Nachricht:

You've launched an older version of Firefox

Using an older version of Firefox can corrupt bookmarks and browsing history already saved to an existing Firefox profile. To protect your information, create a new profile for this installation of Firefox.

Exit Create New Profile

Wir benutzen die aktuellste Firefox-Version 113 und setzen keine Roaming-Profile ein. Es handelt sich um eine Domänenumgebung, in der mit GPOs gearbeitet wird, jedoch ohne spezifische Einstellungen für Firefox. Hat jemand mehr Erfahrung und weiß, woran es liegen könnte? Vielen Dank an alle!

title: Both FireFox and Thunderbird can't connect to server anymore
content:
Hello,

I'm facing a two-fold problem:

1. Firefox (138.0.4, 64-bits): when trying to open a website the URL is loaded in the FF-tab, but the screen stays empty

2. Thunderbird (128.10.0esr, 64-bits): downloading messages isn't possible anymore. When sending a message I get following error message (in Dutch):

Verzenden van het bericht is mislukt. Er is een fout opgetreden bij het verzenden van e-mail: fout met uitgaande (SMTP-)server. De server antwoordde: Cannot connect to SMTP server 127.0.0.1 (127.0.0.1:54601), connect error 10061.

Translated to English:

Sending the message failed. An error occurred while sending the email: Outgoing (SMTP) server error. The server responded: Cannot connect to SMTP server 127.0.0.1 (127.0.0.1:54601), connect error 10061.

I did a ping with following result:

C:\Users\<user>>ping 127.0.0.1

Pinging 127.0.0.1 with 32 bytes of data: Reply from 127.0.0.1: bytes=32 time<1ms TTL=128 Reply from 127.0.0.1: bytes=32 time<1ms TTL=128 Reply from 127.0.0.1: bytes=32 time<1ms TTL=128 Reply from 127.0.0.1: bytes=32 time<1ms TTL=128

Ping statistics for 127.0.0.1: 

   Packets: Sent = 4, Received = 4, Lost = 0 (0% loss),

Approximate round trip times in milli-seconds: 

   Minimum = 0ms, Maximum = 0ms, Average = 0ms


I didn't make any changes to FF and/or TB, and my wild guess is that the necessary Mozilla servers aren't available anymore, due to:

May 21, 2025

No incidents reported today. May 20, 2025 Mozilla Monitor website will be down for 2 hours starting 5/20/2025 at 6 AM PT. Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed. May 20, 15:02 UTC Verifying - Verification is currently underway for the maintenance items. May 20, 14:40 UTC In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary. May 20, 14:00 UTC Scheduled - Mozilla Monitor website will be down for maintenance for 2 hours starting 5/20/2025 at 6 AM PT. During this time, the site will be unavailable.

If somebody could step-in, that would be great!
creator: Thunderbird2015

Ik ben 65jr en redelijk slechtziend, ik red me meestal prima, ook via beeldend geheugen, maar leeswerk kost erg veel tijd en door 33 artikelen heen spitten redt ik gewoon niet, sorry. title: When connecting TB4 with U3225QE, only Firefox changes color
content: DELL's new monitor, U3225QE, can be connected via Thunderbolt 4. I can display 120Hz and Edge and Chrome display without any problems. Only in Firefox there are some areas that should be displayed in white but are displayed in pink. By the way, when connected via HDMI 2.1, the display is 120Hz without any discoloration. If you turn on the dynamic refresh rate, the screen will go black every time you move the mouse. When it is OFF, Firefox browsing does not change color and can be used normally, I called Dell support and they told me, "That's probably a problem with Firefox." It would be helpful if Mozilla could address this issue.

title: firefox.exe ha tentato di stabilire una connessione basata su un certificato di sicurezza non corrispondente per sync.contextualadv.com
content:
Da un apio di mesi, ogni volta che apro Firefox, Bitdefender mi da questo avviso:

Connessione sospetta bloccata

Funzionalità: Prevenzione minacce online

firefox.exe ha tentato di stabilire una connessione basata su un certificato di sicurezza non corrispondente per sync.contextualadv.com. Abbiamo bloccato la connessione per mantenere al sicuro i tuoi dati in quanto il certificato usato è stato emesso per un altro indirizzo web rispetto a quello indicato

Come posso correggere?
creator: Mokshas

title: Ne morem odpreti facebooka
content: Star aem 91 let in na znam angleško. Firefox uporabljam že več kot 20 let,sedaj pa sem nekaj zabrkal in ne morem odpreti facebooka. Besedilo zahteva pomagajte nam sokazati da sem to jaz,nima pa okenca ,da bi kliknil, da sem to jaz. Prijavljen nem na račun viktor.pintaric@triera.net tel. 070 623 802. Prosim, da mi pomagate v slo jeziku.

title: Opening an Image with discord causes Firefox to automatically download the image. How to stop?
content:
Since i've switched defaults to Firefox, every time I 'Open Link' on a discord image, Firefox downloads the image immediately instead of simply opening the image in the browser.

I would like to disable the automatic downloading of the image and instead simply open the image in the browser. How do I make this happen?

title: Firefox not loading certain websites properly
content:
Hi there, I've been experiencing a recurring issue with Firefox recently. Some websites, especially tools and SEO-related platforms like www.buybestseotools.com, aren’t loading correctly—they either show a blank page or take too long to respond.

I've tried clearing the cache, disabling extensions, and even running Firefox in Troubleshoot Mode, but the problem persists. These same websites load just fine in Chrome and Edge.

Is there a setting or recent update that could be causing this compatibility issue in Firefox? Any help would be appreciated.

Thanks!
creator: t46470819

title: Frequent Prompt to Sign in When Access SharePoint Online
content: I'm using Firefox in MacBook. IT Team try to set conditional access from Microsoft to allow persistent token, it work well for Chrome but seems Firefox didn't take effect. Any help can guide me to reduce the frequent prompt to sign in?
